intro: Guettarda trimera, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, drooping clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Guettarda trimera is also valued for its ability to tolerate various soil types and its use in traditional medicine.
